qlabel: 1 PRMM_CHECK_1 - In the last working week, what types of metals were produced where you worked?

categories.catLabel: PRMM_1E Hard metal alloys (e.g., Tungsten carbide, Stellite)
PRMM_1G Lead plated or leaded alloys

qlabel: 2 PRMM_CHECK_2 - In the last working week, at what stages of the smelting and refining process were you involved in?
2A1 PRMM_RADIO_2A1 - In the last working week, did you work on the furnace?
2A1A1 PRMM_CHECK_2A1A1 - What types of furnaces were used?
2A1A2 PRMM_RADIO_2A1A2 - In the last working week, did you handle any metal additives that were added to the furnace to produce alloys?
2A1A2A1 PRMM_CHECK_2A1A2A1 - What types of metal additives did you handle?
2A2 PRMM_RADIO_2A2 - In the last working week, which of the following areas did you work in?
1 PRMM_aFUR_RADIO_2B1_1 - In the last working week, did you re-line, clean or maintain industrial furnaces?
1A1 PRMM_aFUR_CHECK_2B1_1A1 - What did you use to re-line the furnaces?

categories.catLabel: aFUR_1A1B Ceramic fibres or alumino-silicate wools (ASW)

qlabel: 1A2 PRMM_aFUR_RADIO_2B1_1A2 - In the last working week, did you remove or maintain lining made out of asbestos?
1A3 PRMM_aFUR_RADIO_2B1_1A3 - Was there a ventilated hood over the furnace when you were working on it?
1A4 PRMM_aFUR_RADIO_2B1_1A4 - In the last working week, did you use respiratory protection equipment when re-lining, cleaning or maintaining furnaces?
1A4A1 PRMM_aFUR_CHECK_2B1_1A4A1 - What types of respiratory protective equipment (RPE) did you use?

categories.catLabel: aFUR_1A4A1A Rubber face mask fitted with a particle filter or a cartridge
aFUR_1A4A1C Air-supplied respirator or SCBA (self-contained breathing apparatus)
aFUR_1A4A1D A filtering face piece mask or dust mask (called an FFP)

qlabel: 1A5 PRMM_aFUR_RADIO_2B1_1A5 - In the last working week, did you manually clean out ash or scale from the furnace?
1A5A1 PRMM_aFUR_RADIO_2B1_1A5A1 - In the last working week, did you use an ash vacuum cleaner fitted with a HEPA filter to clean out the ash or scale from the furnace?
1A5A2 PRMM_aFUR_RADIO_2B1_1A5A2 - In the last working week, were dust suppression precautions taken to minimise dust levels (e.g., by controlled damping of the ash)?
1A5A3 PRMM_aFUR_RADIO_2B1_1A5A3 - In the last working week, did you wear respiratory protection when manually cleaning ash or scale from the furnace?
1A5A3A1 PRMM_aFUR_CHECK_2B1_1A5A3A1 - What types of respiratory protective equipment (RPE) did you use?

categories.catLabel: aFUR_1A5A3A1A Rubber face mask fitted with a particle/vapour filter or a cartridge
aFUR_1A5A3A1C Air-supplied respirator or SCBA (self-contained breathing apparatus)
aFUR_1A5A3A1D A filtering face piece mask or dust mask (called an FFP)

2C2A1 PRMM_RADIO_2C2A1 - Were you in a refuge when crushing indoors?
2C3 PRMM_RADIO_2C3 - Was there water dust suppression in the crushing area?

categories.catLabel: PRMM_2C4A1A Rubber face mask fitted with a particle/vapour filter or a cartridge
PRMM_2C4A1C Air-supplied respirator or SCBA (self-contained breathing apparatus)
PRMM_2C4A1D A filtering face piece mask or a dust mask (called an FFP)

1 PRMM_aSER_RADIO_4_1 - In the last working week, did you access service tunnels to do activities of removal, assembling or maintenance?
1A1 PRMM_aSER_RADIO_4_1A1 - Were the tunnels in a building which was constructed before 2005? [IPSOS: DE, FI: 1993; FR: 1997; IE: 2000; ES: 2002 ; HU: 2005]
1A1A1 PRMM_aSER_RADIO_4_1A1A1 - In the last working week, did you see pipes with lagging or insulation around where you were working in the tunnels?
1A1A1A1 PRMM_aSER_RADIO_4_1A1A1A1 - Was the insulation crumbly or fibrous?
1A2 PRMM_aSER_CHECK_4_1A2 - How were the service tunnels ventilated?

categories.catLabel: aSER_1A2A By local exhaust ventilation which captured the vapour, dust, fume at the emission point
aSER_1A2B By on-tool extraction to remove dust and fumes away from your face
aSER_1A2C By a general ventilation system
aSER_1A2D By fans in the window or doorway
aSER_1A2E By open doors or windows
aSER_1A2F No ventilation was applied to the area
